# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Sure, here is a Julia function that achieves this. This code uses the DataFrames.jl package which provides high performance data manipulation and analysis capabilities in Julia.
```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map((x) -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df.dt)
end
```
This function iterates through each element of the `dt` column in the input DataFrame, extracts the year and month using the `Dates.year` and `Dates.month` functions respectively, and then concatenates them together as an integer. The result is stored in a new column called `ym`.

You can call this function on your DataFrame like so:
```julia
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will modify the DataFrame in-place to add the new column.
